title: Why are Galio mains still asking for buffs?
body:
it's pretty much clear that you CANT BUFF GALIO WITHOUT BREAKING HIM IN PRO which is something that forced riot to nerf galio 5 or 8 times now

the only thing you can ask is a rework revert that created shen 2.0

replies.body:
IDK how you can main a champ with that much CC and tankiness and think it needs buffs.

Like ok keep posting about winrates, idgaf.

> [{quoted}](name=Khristophoros,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=6TEO9wP2,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2018-06-03T22:13:13.491+0000)
>
> IDK how you can main a champ with that much CC and tankiness and think it needs buffs.
> 
> Like ok keep posting about winrates, idgaf.

Because the champion has too many strings attached to it in exchange for that CC. Damage is practically non-existent unless you build 3 AP items, at which point you don't function well enough as a tank despite doing subpar damage as a bruiser

You don't live long enough as a tank unless you build 4 tank items, but at that point, you haven't done damage all game, and you won't for the rest of it, relying on everyone else to win (If your team sucks, you are fucked).

Riot needs to move Galio from one role to the other. Tank, or AP bruiser. None of this half and half bulls**t.

Honestly if you want to main him you should always duo with a carry player. His ult is insane if you have somebody who's coordinating with you. His CC is also generous even as far as tanks go. His damage isn't half bad, like when I play support Galio I get kills easily.

Like you don't even need to be playing with a full 5 man team for him to be a good champ. You just have to not be playing solo.

It's too much to ask of Riot to make him good for pure solo play and also balanced for more organized duo strats and also balanced in organized 5 man (pro and clash basically)

They don't care about pro play.

They just want to be able to play a champion they love without handicapping themselves or their team.

they don't
but riot cares about $
It's time to a 'pro' server where champions are balanced entirely differently IMO.
